answers.content_html: Friction is an internal force that opposes the relative motion of an object.
answers.feedback_html: It is correct that friction opposes the relative motion of an object, but it is not an internal force. Try to differentiate between internal and external forces.

answers.content_html: Friction is an internal force that accelerates an objectâ€™s relative motion.
answers.feedback_html: Friction is not an internal force. Review the definition of friction.

answers.content_html: Friction is an external force that opposes the relative motion of an object.
answers.feedback_html: Friction is an external force that opposes the motion of an object.

answers.content_html: Friction is an external force that increases the velocity of the relative motion of an object.
answers.feedback_html: Yes, friction is an external force, but it acts in opposition to the relative motion. Try to explain how an object comes to rest.
The coefficient of kinetic friction cannot be zero. The zero coefficient of kinetic friction represents zero kinetic friction between the object and the surface which is not possible practically.
Consider the fact that the magnitude of the kinetic friction is less than the maximum limiting static friction.
The magnitude of the kinetic friction is less than that of the maximum limiting static friction.
The magnitude of kinetic friction is not greater than that of the maximum limiting static friction. Recall the definition of kinetic friction.

stem_html: A box weighing 500\,\text{N} is at rest on the floor. A person pushes against it and it starts moving when 100\,\text{N} force is applied to it. What can be said about the coefficient of kinetic friction between the box and the floor?

answers.content_html: It increases with the increase in the relative motion.
answers.feedback_html: The coefficient of kinetic friction, which is a property of matter, cannot change with the change in the relative motion between the two surfaces.

answers.content_html: It decreases with the increase in the relative motion.
answers.feedback_html: Consider the fact that the coefficient of kinetic friction is related to the property of matter and is independent of the dynamics of the object and surfaces.

answers.content_html: It remains constant and is independent of the relative motion.
answers.feedback_html: The coefficient of kinetic friction is independent of the relative motion of the two surfaces and remains constant.

stem_html: Two surfaces in contact are moving slowly past each other. As the relative speed between the two surfaces in contact increases, what happens to the magnitude of their coefficient of kinetic friction?

answers.feedback_html: At an inclination of 0^\circ\!, the perpendicular component of the weight is maximum.
Consider the fact that the perpendicular component of the weight is the cosine component of the weight.
The perpendicular component of the weight is not maximum when the angle of inclination of the plane is 60^\circ\!. The perpendicular component of the weight is the cosine component of the weight.
The perpendicular component of the weight is not maximum at an angle of inclination of 90^\circ\!. Consider the fact that the cosine of 90^\circ\! is zero.

stem_html: A box is sitting on an inclined plane. At what angle of incline is the perpendicular component of the box's weight at its maximum?
